brief.content-text:
The animation depicts inter-V LAN routing. A subinterface is used to establish communication between multiple V LANs. There are three V LAN's, V LAN 1, V LAN 15, and V LAN 35, each represented by a different colored circle. All three V LAN's connect to the Router via a single link (subinterface). The link has been divided up into three logical pathways (one per V LAN).

Network
One Router (R1).
One Switch (S1).
R1 is connected to S1 via a single link, F A 0 / 0, using three subinterfaces:
F A 0 / 0.1 for V LAN 1, F A 0 / 0.15 for V LAN 15, and F A 0/0.35 for V LAN 35.
S1 has three V LAN's (V LAN 1, V LAN 15, V LAN 35).
V LAN 1 has one Host
V LAN 15 has two Hosts
V LAN 35 has one Host
